rComments: Sweet professor, but difficult to follow and way too hard of a marker.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Get ready to read', 'Tough grader']

rComments: The class is very theory heavy. Class average was a B, the class is of a small size and you don't get a lot of room to make mistakes. Make sure you submit the JITT, they make the difference between grade boundaries and do your readings!

Bertoldi is so sweet and approachable. She's a prof that really cares about her students. Unfortunately, the grading in her class is tough. I didn't love it and a lot of people had similar complaints. If you want an A, good luck. Definitely reserved for exceptionality. But you'll probably end up getting by w/ a decent grade b/c of participation pts
Bertoldi is very sweet, and genuinely cares about her students, but BEWARE, despite this sweet persona she is a very hard marker.

If all people in this world were like her, there would be no wars. She is an amazing professor and human being, who is completely dedicated to her students and her field. The lectures were not only interesting but extremely moving. She brings you back in touch with your human side after years of UofT desensitization. I love this prof!

Cares about her students. Super engaging and lots of participation. Goes out of her way to accommodate students. Readings are heavy, but don't need to do all of them b/c she gives the main points in class. Readings were also very engaging. Things she teaches can actually be applied to life, unlike many other UofT courses which are all theory based.

sweetest professor! very caring for students and accommodating and engaging. available outside of class. don't even have to do all the readings because she provides great summaries during lectures (excellent for midterms because she covers the main points). very knowledgeable and enthusiastic! readings were very interesting but very high work load.
